basics.name: Marianne Bulger
basics.label: Partner at Drive Capital | Talent & Network Intelligence, People Strategy, Executive Coach
basics.summary:
I am an impact-driven entrepreneur and network intelligence executive with a people-first philosophy. I have combined my professional leadership in the innovation economy with an academic foundation in international human rights to work as a cross-functional founder and people leader in the tech startup ecosystem. I think outside the box, cut the red tape, revel in collaboration, and carry a fresh perspective on how to amplify the impact of human-centric experiences to drive business outcomes. 

In the past 10 years, I have purposely sought out work in the critical corners of the Canadian tech ecosystem — as a founder, a team member, a board member, and an investor. I've helped to build a world-renowned accelerator, co-founded Canada's largest tech meetup group, operated within early-stage startups, worked in venture capital, and founded my own national organization. Now, I am an operating partner at a VC firm that invests in founders who are building category-defining businesses in often overlooked cities across the continent. 

The common thread for me has always been to help people find one another. I believe that great people, together, build incredible things. I also believe that Canada is one of the best places in the world to build a business and, frankly, just be human.

work.summary:
Today, you can build a world-class technology company almost anywhere. The best advantages are the ones you already have. We want you to build from King West, the Short North, or West Loop. Build where your talent is. Build where your customers are. Build where you’re strongest.

Drive Capital invests in founders building the next generation of iconic tech companies, at all stages and across sectors where we've built deep conviction and expertise. Portfolio companies include Root, Duolingo, Olive, Greenlight, Path Robotics, KOHO, ApplyBoard, Skywatch, Cyclica and Branch.

As the Canadian Talent Partner at Drive Capital, I support the hiring efforts of our portfolio companies through executive coaching, network development, talent referral, recruiter relationship management, and advisory services related to hiring, compensation, and talent retention best practices.

Supporting the operations, product development, and expansion of the VC Platform Global Community, an invite-only community set up to be a peer-learning vehicle for those who actively work in VC and are in charge of growing, supporting, and creating communities for their firm’s portfolio companies.
Growclass is a universe of practical marketing courses taught by experts.
A 2000+ community of HR, Talent & People Ops professionals, passionate about employee & candidate experience.

C100 is a privately-funded, not-for-profit member association for its members across Canada, the United States, and beyond. C100 is fueled by its global members who join our mission to inspire, support, and connect the most promising Canadian leaders in tech at home and abroad.

When the pandemic hit in 2020, thousands of Canadian tech workers lost their jobs. The Help List was created to help available talent land a new opportunity with a Canadian startup during the early days of COVID-19. Over 4,000 people and hundreds of companies benefited from this open source resource, making it the largest of its kind in the world in 2020.

Prospect (now Work in Tech by Communitech) is Canada's largest startup job board and talent data source. Our mission is to unite the global talent pool with Canada’s fastest-growing companies by centralizing all of the startup career opportunities in one free and easy-to-search location.

As founder and CEO of Prospect, I oversaw the organization's operations, fundraising, and product development. I led the development of Prospect's core products, including scaling the job board from 0 to 1200 startups, launching a national layoff list, and publishing multi-annual market reports on the state of talent.

As the first operating member to the team, I owned the firm's portfolio impact program, including network intelligence strategy, business operations, audience engagement, resource development, marketing/communications, talent engagement, PR, and wider industry involvement. I leveraged data systems and a tech stack to streamline the natural growth of our fund and its brand. As a value-add to our portfolio, I designed creative, outcome-driven workshops, events, and experiences for our network. 

I led the organization's rebrand, website redevelopment, and Fund III announcement. Launched the fund's external communication strategy, PR, job board development, referred talent program, service providers system, and first CRM integration.

Free Geek Toronto is a non-profit social enterprise that helps bridge the digital divide. Our goal is to make Toronto a place where e-waste is disposed of responsibly, safely and ethically, and where everyone has access to computers and the internet.

In this role, I served as the primary bridge to external stakeholders (including the global medical, scientific, patient, technology, design, and press communities) by shaping and communicating the story of the Human Diagnosis Project.

During my time consulting with the leadership team, I led the application to the McCarther Foundation's 100 and Change bid, led key stakeholder relations, market research, SEO, growth marketing, recruitment, brand development, UX design, and external communications.

What began as a social experiment and art project, has now become a worldwide movement to increase mindfulness, camaraderie, wellness, self-expression, and mischief. Daybreaker is a sober morning dance party hosted weekly cities across the globe.

As the Toronto Producer, I was responsible for building an engaged and passionate community, producing mind-blowing experiences, and promoting the events to relevant audiences. Responsibilities include finding venues, sourcing talent and performers, cultivating a volunteer production team, coordinating with vendors and sponsors, creating local partnerships, and producing monthly events.

What started as a small, 30-person monthly meetup, quickly grew into a national movement towards purposeful learning experiences in the innovation sector. 

Led the strategic development, design, stakeholder outreach and operational launch of six unique brands, including Tech Toronto, Tech Vancouver, Tech Waterloo Region, SalesTO, HealthTO, and FintechTO. Scaled to 2000+ monthly event attendees and 18,000+ subscribers/followers.

Responsibilities included audience development, market research, speaker relations, external communications, web development, graphic design, growth marketing, partner cultivation, event logistics, and organizational operations.

Supported the leadership team in the launch and scale of their external marketing and communications efforts, including website design, social media, SEO, market research, conference and client materials.

Joining the DMZ team in its early days, I was fortunate to contribute to the growth of the institution and organization on multiple levels. 

Project managing the organizations' eight-person marketing team under the leadership of the Director of Marketing Communications, I was responsible for all activities related to our external brand strategy and stakeholder relations. 

With such a wide-ranging mandate, my responsibilities were vast, supporting stakeholder relations, fundraising, content creation, media relations, graphic design, videography, photography, social media, web development, workshop design, event production, and conference sponsorship.

I contributed to the establishment of the DMZ as North America's top-ranked university-based incubator (as stated by the UBI Index), the full rebrand of the company, and the growth of the organization to Canada's largest tech incubator.
Market research, workshop design, partner relations, proposal development, grant writing.
Conducted field research on ECCC court system and translated victim testimonials for the English-speaking ICC members.

volunteer.organization: Jays Care Foundation Young Professionals Network

education.area: People Analytics: Adding Data to the Art of Understanding People at Work

education.institution: University of Toronto - Ontario Institute for Studies in Education
education.area: Adult and Continuing Education and Teaching

references.name: Brendan Dellandrea
references.reference: Marianne is an inspired creative thinker who provides valuable insights and executional follow-through on marketing projects, events and special initiatives. She provided essential creative input and project leadership for our rebrand project and every major event, conference and tradeshow over the past two years. Marianne excels at building relationships, fostering culture and collaboration and is a versatile enabler of the creative process for teams large and small.  Marianne has been an integral part of our collaborative organization, keeping all the moving parts headed in the same direction, while managing production processes against aggressive timelines. Marianne continues to find new ways to express our brand in events, collateral and experiences.

references.name: Max LV
references.reference:
Marianne Bulger is an innovator that has an amazing combination of Business acumen and artistic flair. 

Marianne has the amazing ability to bring people together, I saw this first hand while watching her work closely with an amazing amount of technology startups at North America's #1 University Business Incubator, The DMZ at Ryerson. Marianne played a critical role in getting the DMZ to the continent's top spot.

Marianne's ability to adapt to any situation is a skill that cannot be matched.

Companies would be lucky to have Marianne apart of their organization in a Leadership Role.
